intro: Cephalostigma ramosissimum, commonly known as the hairy bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its leaves are typically alternate and pinnately lobed, with a rough texture. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions.
